body:
@kchibisov You should be more aware of the recent X11 modifier changes in Winit than me. Do you think there's still the possibility for a racing condition here?

From what I remember, the modifiers on X11 are retrieved on every key press. So it shouldn't be possible to have key events with incorrect modifiers attached?
There were cases where the modifier was set wrongly on the key itself. One could provide the `xtrace` output, it should be pretty clear from it.

Output was `qe12345^7*()`

```
xtrace -n --relative-timestamps -o xtrace.log alacritty
```

Interesting part should start around 10/11 seconds, when I hit ctrl-shift-k to trigger keepassxc autocomplete, and then ctrl-2 to type password

[xtrace.log](https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/files/15058535/xtrace.log)

I think I'm having the same issue with my programmable keyboard. I have a symbol layer that has a dedicated key for `_`, but occasionally when I type it quickly alacritty sees the `-` character instead. I haven't noticed this on any other application.

```
alacritty --version
alacritty 0.15.0-dev (1063706f)
```
Here's the `--print-events` output:

https://gist.github.com/emesterhazy/98cb03a2c2abd694a3f93a4f40f237dc

It looks like the shift isn't being applied to the `-` key for some reason.

I did some manual bisecting using the tagged releases on crates.io.

- 0.12.0: No issues
- 0.12.3: No issues
- 0.13.0: Broken

I love Alacritty but this is a pretty showstopping issue for me on the newer versions since I basically can't use the symbol layer of my keyboard. Willing to take a look into it if someone can point me to the right place in the code. I may also start bisecting between 0.12.3 and 0.13.0 to see if I can find the bad change.

@kchibisov In case you know where to look or have other suggestions.

Ok, I finished bisecting and found that the bad commit is db903503df024a3f5066937fbe0272be88226738

I haven't dug into the changes in that commit yet, but I'll see if there's an obvious issue. By the way, this issue should probably be renamed since this doesn't seem to be specific to KeepassXC, and affects all versions after the commit I posted above.

Edit: I'm guessing this is a bug in winit, but I'm not 100% sure. Possibly related:

- https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/issues/3769
- https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/issues/2898

issue.title: text and text_with_all_modifiers, don't contain the shifted text when using Plover steno input

labels.name: DS - x11
labels.description: Affects the X11 backend, or generally free Unix platforms

repository.name: winit
repository.description: Window handling library in pure Rust

issue.body:
This was originally reported here by @simonlearnscoding
* https://github.com/neovide/neovide/issues/2675

Shifted chararacters are not detected when using [Plover](https://github.com/openstenoproject/plover)

From the Neovide logs attached it looks like the shift state is detected properly, but `text` and `text_with_all_modifiers`  remain as the unshifted character.

I'm not sure which all platforms are affected, but at least Linux X11.

It has also been tested with the latest Alacritty git version, on the other hand Alacritty 0.12.2 works as expected, so there's probably something that broke in winit 0.29. And related to the rapid sequence of keypresses that Plover emits.

body:
Thanks a lot for fixing this. I'll test it out this weekend to see if it fixed the issue I have with ZMK.

I guess the fix commit is https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/commit/5e6350d14269132412e558d9f40f07c8180bb635? Do you have any intuition for whether this fixes https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/issues/3769 as well? I'm guessing that it does, so perhaps we can close that issue as well.

it's all pretty much the same bug with replay from IME input, that's the reason it also happened only for _some people_.

If you have ibus/whatever running it would cause this, since without replay it was never an issue.
